modules.description: Reads and writes image data in various formats, supporting 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit per channel representations with specified color spaces. Processes images from file paths or byte buffers, and outputs to PNG, JPEG, and HDR formats with customizable quality settings. Handles image data as typed structures with explicit channel types and color configurations.

Reads and writes images using command-line tools, supporting formats like PNG and JPEG. Processes images in grayscale, RGB, and RGBA color spaces, handling both single and multiple image inputs. Adjusts conversion and identification commands to interface with ImageMagick or GraphicsMagick.

Maps a file into memory with specified offset and mode, returning a data structure for accessing its contents. Works with file paths, integer sizes, and custom image types for low-level data manipulation. Used to efficiently process large binary files such as memory dumps or raw disk images.

Handles memory-mapped image loading with precise control over offset and access mode, supporting various pixel formats and color types. Operates on image data represented through Bimage's type system, including pixel and color specifications. Used to efficiently load large image files into memory for real-time processing or rendering tasks.

Provides functions for loading, saving, and manipulating images using bigarrays as the underlying storage mechanism. Includes operations for pixel-wise transformations, color space conversions, and basic image filtering. Used to process raw image data in applications such as computer vision pipelines and graphical user interfaces.

loads and manipulates image data from files or memory-mapped regions, supporting multiple bit depths and color spaces, and enabling efficient processing of large binary images. It provides operations for reading and writing images in common formats, converting between color spaces, and accessing raw pixel data through typed structures. Users can process images via command-line tools or direct memory access, adjusting quality, format, and pixel representation as needed. Examples include converting a raw disk image to a PNG, adjusting JPEG compression, or extracting specific color channels from an HDR file.
